example.eg: The boy was so awkward that he kept knocking things over.
example.egtrans: 这个男孩笨手笨脚的，总是把东西碰倒。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 笨拙的, 笨手笨脚的

example.eg: My nephew is entering that awkward stage of adolescence.
example.egtrans: 我侄子正步入最难相处的青春期了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 难对付的, 难相处的

example.eg: I had an awkward conversation with my ex-girlfriend.
example.egtrans: 我和前女友尴尬地聊了一会儿。

example.eg: I never know what to do in these awkward social situations.
example.egtrans: 面对这些棘手的社交场合，我从不知道自己该做些什么。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 棘手的, 难处理的, 难办的

example.eg: The diving equipment felt awkward when he wore it for the first time.
example.egtrans: 第一次穿戴潜水设备时，他感觉设备并不怎么好用。

example.eg: Our attempt to move the heavy sofa led to an awkward trip down the stairs.
example.egtrans: 虽然沙发非常重，但我们还是试图将其搬到楼下，搞得既危险，又狼狈不堪。

example.eg: Andrea gave you a bottle of wine even though you don't drink alcohol? Awkward!
example.egtrans: 尽管你不喝酒，安德烈还是给了你一瓶葡萄酒？真尴尬！

example.eg: Her thoughtless remarks about Janet put us all in an awkward position.
